text:
In attached build.xml file  unzip-include target is OK 
but unzip-exclude target failed.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you use Eclipse then real test is install-plugins target in ant script to 
update/install Eclipse
http://home.nyc.rr.com/olegs/#Eclipse

you can test with following plugins:
plugin without plugins directory could be http://sourceforge.net/projects/xmen
and with plugins directory could be 
http://sourceforge.net/projects/solareclipse/
creator: oleg_shteynbuk@yahoo.com
oleg_shteynbuk@yahoo.com
text:
forget to mention that there is workaround that I use in install/update script:
 1.   unzip into temporary directory using fileset only, patternset will be 
replaced by fileset in step 2.
 2.   copy using fileset

creator: levylambert@tiscali-dsl.de
text:
I summarize your bug report by saying that you complain that exclude patterns do not work. I have 
tried this myself against the CVS head version of Expand.java (the underlying class for the unzip 
task) and I do not have problems with exclude patterns.
Here was my snippet :
<target 
name="expexclude">
<delete dir="output2" quiet="true"/>
<unzip  dest="output2">
    
<patternset>
<exclude  name="jdepend/docs/**"/>
<exclude  name="jdepend/lib/**"/>
    
</patternset>
    <fileset dir="." >
      <include name="**/*.zip"/>
    
</fileset>
</unzip>
</target>
I did not get the jdepend/docs and jdepend/lib paths in the 
output2 subdir, so this looks OK
Which version of ant are you using ?
Can you reproduce your 
problem in a small build file ?
Another point : whether zip files are listed in a fileset or are 
taken individually should not make any difference.

creator: oleg_shteynbuk@yahoo.com
text:
in my case i get an empty folder, so i did not get files that i want to exclude 
too but i did not get the ones that i do not exclude either. attached build.xml 
test file is on the top of this page under the first additional comments 

Created an attachment (id=4617)
test

there are two targets unzip-exclude and unzip-include. unzip-include just to 
show that include works; unzip-exclude is the default target. 

ant version:
C:\dev\eclipse\antBug>ant -version
Apache Ant version 1.5.1 compiled on October 2 2002

BTW i get the nightly build but was not able to run it, some strange message 
that command line argumennt string is too long or smth. like this.

creator: ddevienne@lgc.com
text:
I glanced at your build.xml, and you have one <patternset> with only <exclude> 
nested elements, and no <include>. You need <include name="**/*" /> to unzip 
something I would think... --DD

no, it seems that it is not required to have include patternsets, it looks like everything which is 
not explicitly excluded is included
creator: levylambert@tiscali-dsl.de
